briefdescription.para: global empty string, sometimes needed as return value in some std::string &function() return values.
std::for_each except just on containers.
Filters items from a container which satisfy a certain predicate.
Demangles a symbol name.

detaileddescription.para: On failure, the mangled symbol name is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the (demangled) symbol name for a given address.

detaileddescription.para: If no exact match can be found, if require_exact_addr == true (default): if no_pure_addrs == false (default): a pure hex address string is returned else: an empty string is returned if require_exact_addr == false: name of closest symbol + offset hex string is returned
pxd: string symbol_name(const void *addr) except +

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the address is the (exact) address of a symbol.
read a single csv file.

detaileddescription.para: call the destination struct .fill() method for actually storing line data

memberdef.definition: static constexpr std::enable_if<(amount + (std::is_signed<T>::value ? 1 : 0) < sizeof(T) * CHAR_BIT), T>::type openage::util::safe_shiftleft
memberdef.name: safe_shiftleft

briefdescription.para: Helper function that performs a left shift without causing undefined behavior.

detaileddescription.para: regular left-shift is undefined if amount >= bitwidth, or amount >= bitwidth - 1 for signed integers.

memberdef.definition: static constexpr std::enable_if<(amount >= sizeof(T) * CHAR_BIT), T>::type openage::util::safe_shiftright
memberdef.name: safe_shiftright

briefdescription.para: Helper function that performs a right shift without causing undefined behavior.

detaileddescription.para: right-shift is usually undefined if amount >= bit size.

memberdef.definition: static constexpr std::enable_if<(amount < sizeof(T) * CHAR_BIT), T>::type openage::util::safe_shiftright
memberdef.name: safe_shiftright

briefdescription.para: Helper function that performs either a safe shift-right (amount > 0), or a safe shift-left (amount < 0).

A hash combination function Creates a hash value as a combination of two other hashes.

detaileddescription.para: Can be called incrementally to create hash value from several variables. Will always produce the same result for the same combination of hash1 and hash2 during a single run of a program.

briefdescription.para: Siphash implementation.
Helper function to generate hash of certain type T.
Wrapping a function call with ignore_result makes it more clear to readers, compilers and linters that you are, in fact, ignoring the function's return value on purpose.

memberdef.name: operator*

briefdescription.para: Scalar multiplication with swapped arguments for int.

detaileddescription.para: This was just added because otherwise the above float-multiplication function might not match to the template deduction.

briefdescription.para: modulo operation that guarantees to return positive values.
compiletime defined modulo function.
compiletime defined rotate left function
implements the 'correct' version of the division operator, which always rounds to -inf
Convert a C-style array of uint8_t to a uint64_t.

detaileddescription.para: Uses little-endianness as default. Fills the remaining bytes with zeroes.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to start of the input data.

simplesect.para: Input data as a 64 bit number.

briefdescription.para: Convert a uint64_t to an array of uint8_t.

detaileddescription.para: Uses little-endianness as default.
e.g (big-endian): 0x0123456789abcdef -> {0x01, 0x23, 0x45, 0x67, 0x89, 0xab, 0xcd, 0xef} e.g (little-endian): 0x0123456789abcdef -> {0xef, 0xcd, 0xab, 0x89, 0x67, 0x45, 0x23, 0x01}

simplesect.para: Input data as a 8 bit number array.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of uint64-elements that result from converting a count-sized uint8_t array.

detaileddescription.para: Used to determine the size for array8_to_array64()

briefdescription.para: Convert a C-style array of uint8_t to a std::vector of uint64_t.

detaileddescription.para: Uses little-endianness as default. Fills the remaining bytes of the last uint64_t with zeroes.

simplesect.para: Input data as a 64 bit number vector.

briefdescription.para: Convert a C-style array of uint64_t to a std::vector of uint8_t.

detaileddescription.para: Uses little-endianness as default.
e.g (big-endian): 0x0123456789abcdef -> {0x01, 0x23, 0x45, 0x67, 0x89, 0xab, 0xcd, 0xef} e.g (little-endian): 0x0123456789abcdef -> {0xef, 0xcd, 0xab, 0x89, 0x67, 0x45, 0x23, 0x01}

simplesect.para: Input data as a 8 bit number vector.

briefdescription.para: Extend a vector with elements, without destroying source one.
Remove the given element index in the vector.

detaileddescription.para: May swap with the end element for efficient removing.
If the element is not in the vector, do nothing.

briefdescription.para: query the current opengl context for any errors.

detaileddescription.para: raises exceptions on any error.

briefdescription.para: Strip out ../ etc.
get the filename (last part) of a given path
return the head (dirname) part of a path.
method that behaves similar to python's "repr".

detaileddescription.para: puts the string in quotes and escapes all sorts of stuff inside.

briefdescription.para: printf-style to-string formatting.
printf-style valist-to-string formatting; the result is appended to output.
Copies the given string to the returned unique_ptr, including 0 byte.
Returns the number of whitespace characters on the right of the string.
returns true if str matches the basic globbing pattern in the pattern, '*' matches any number of characters, while all other characters are interpreted as literal.
Split a string at a delimiter into a vector.

detaileddescription.para: Internally, uses the above iterator splitter.

briefdescription.para: Split a string at a delimiter into a vector.

detaileddescription.para: size_hint is to give a predicted size of the vector already.
tokenizes txt by splitting it up to substrings at the deliminiters. "\n" is evaluated to ' '; all other '' escape sequences are evaluated to literal X, including the deliminiter.

briefdescription.para: Split a string at a delimiter, push the result back in an iterator.

detaileddescription.para: Why doesn't the fucking standard library have std::string::split(delimiter)?

briefdescription.para: Returns the unique identifier of the current thread.

detaileddescription.para: For compilers with support for thread_local storage, the function also guarantees to return strictly monotonically increasing identifier (no collision).

briefdescription.para: decodes a UTF-8 character string of given length

detaileddescription.para: the results are written to outbuf. no leading 0 is written to outbuf (nor is one expected at s). outbuf MUST be large enough to hold all characters. to ensure that outbuf is large enough, it SHOULD have a size of at least len.
the number of actual unicode characters is returned. it might be anywhere in the range [len/4; len].
in case of decoding errors, the special unicode character 0xfffd is written.
code logic gratefully borrowed from rxvt-unicode.

briefdescription.para: encodes one Unicode codepoint to a null-terminated UTF-8 character string.

detaileddescription.para: due to the nature of UTF-8, the result string is at most 4 bytes long. on error, the empty string is returned.

cp the codepoint outbuf a output char buffer. outbuf[0] to outbuf[4] MUST be writeable. outbuf[0] will ALWAYS be written to. returns the number of non-NULL bytes that have been written, i.e. strlen(outbuf)

briefdescription.para: computes the length of the last character in a given UTF-8 string.

detaileddescription.para: str the UTF-8 string returns the length of the last character in bytes

briefdescription.para: pops back (deletes) the last UTF-8 character in a std::string.
